meanings.definition: The belief in a single origin or source.
meanings.sent1: Many ancient cultures held onto the monogenies of humanity.
meanings.sent2: The monogenies of all languages can be traced back to a common root.
meanings.sent3: It's fascinating how the monogenies of myths often intertwine.
meanings.sent4: The monogenies of music can be found in the rhythm of nature.
meanings.sent5: The monogenies of art reveal the universal themes of human emotion.

meanings.definition: The study of the common ancestry of a group of organisms.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use monogenies to understand the evolutionary history of species.
meanings.sent2: The monogenies of birds show how they are all connected through evolution.
meanings.sent3: In the world of biology, monogenies can be a real puzzle to solve.
meanings.sent4: The monogenies of plants reveal the intricate web of life on Earth.
meanings.sent5: Studying monogenies helps us appreciate the diversity of life forms.
